results.title: Face value
results.brief_description: Explores the lives of three facially disfigured individuals in a sensitive and moving series of interviews. Discusses the meaning of beauty, the value of physical appearances in society and the importance of every human being.

results.title: Explore Australia 1997 (PC & MAC)
results.brief_description: Explore Australia 1997 is a cyber guide for the desktop traveller, allowing the user to explore some of Australia’s top tourist destinations without leaving the comforts of home. Search thousands of towns, explore big city highlights, obtain information on Australia’s best national parks, and research accommodation Australia-wide. Easy to use, and can be linked to a companion website packed with additional information.

results.title: Circulatory system
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Human Body”.
Animation, cinefluorography, drawings, and close-ups of live organs are used in analysing the entire circulatory system. Explains in detail the functions of the heart, lungs, and kidneys; follows the flow of blood through all parts of the body; and explains the role of the circulatory system in maintaining good health.

results.title: Respiratory system
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Human Body”.
The organs of the respiratory system; mechanics of ventilation and physics of diffusion between alveoli and capillaries; effect on respiratory system of varying needs for oxygen; function of respiratory system in providing needed oxygen and eliminating carbon dioxide.

results.title: Muscular system [b&w]
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Human Body”.
This film looks at the three types of muscle in the human musculature system. The structure of the muscle, the nerve impulse and the chemical process of muscular movement are explained.

results.title: Reproductive system
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Human Body”.
Uses animation and photomicrography to present a description of the human reproductive system. Shows similarities and differences between male and female reproductive organs, locates them in the body and describes the specific functions of each in the creation of life. No other credits available.

results.title: Reproductive system. - 2nd. ed.
results.creator_credit: Coronet Instructional Media and Instant Miracles
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Human Body”.
Part of a series which comprehensively covers the major systems of the body. This episode examines the functions of the reproductive system in the male and female. Diagrammatic animation illustrates how pituitary hormones control and the maturation and functioning of the organs and how they in turn make reproduction possible through the union of egg and sperm.

results.title: Nutrition and metabolism
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Human Body”.
Show the relationship between nutrition and metabolism. Demonstrates that a balanced diet produces the proper amounts of energy producing foods and essential chemicals needed for body building, and tells why each food type yields the quantity of calories it does. Show how people performing different activities require varied calorie consumption, through the use of animation, diagrams, and live action application in practical situations. No other credits available.
